description_txt: stated on October 4, 2016 in the 2016 Vice Presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says "Iraq has been overrun by ISIS because Hillary Clinton failed to renegotiate . . . a status of forces agreement."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2016 in a pre-debate appearance in Virginia:
quote_txt: "In the state of Indiana, I’ve signed more than $3.5 billion in tax relief."

description_txt: stated on October 4, 2016 in the 2016 Vice Presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says Tim Kaine "actually tried to raise taxes by about $4 billion."

description_txt: stated on October 4, 2016 in the 2016 Vice Presidential debate:
quote_txt: "First, Donald Trump said wages are too high, and both Donald Trump and Mike Pence think we ought to eliminate the federal minimum wage."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2016 in In a political ad:
quote_txt: Says Senate candidate Katie McGinty "made thousands from companies she previously regulated."

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2016 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: The U.S. Senate has "one manufacturer — that'd be me."

description_txt: stated on September 19, 2016 in a press conference:
quote_txt: Even our attorney general who is a strong Democrat, she has said that we need causation in our workers’ comp system. That’s the No. 1 thing pushing our manufacturing jobs out of Illinois.

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2016 in a web video.:
quote_txt: "The Virginia population increased by just 8 percent from 2005 to 2015, but the per capita spending in the budget increased by a whopping 38 percent."

description_txt: stated on August 9, 2016 in an Instagram post:
quote_txt: "A rural hospital in Missouri closes every 8 months. The legislature’s failure to expand Medicaid has brought crisis to many of Missouri’s rural health care providers."

description_txt: stated on August 15, 2016 in in official ballot argument. :
quote_txt: "Not one penny of (California’s Prop 67) bag ban tax goes to the environment."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2016 in a chain email:
quote_txt: On Tim Kaine: "In exchange for campaign contributions, he appointed a radical jihadi to the Virginia Immigration Commission."

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2016 in an interview on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "The 'New York Times' writes this long story" about Donald Trump’s tax returns but "didn't point out there was no wrongdoing" until paragraph 18.

description_txt: stated on September 26, 2016 in the first presidential debate at Hofstra University:
quote_txt: The Great Recession emerged "in large part because of tax policies that slashed taxes on the wealthy, failed to invest in the middle class, took their eyes off of Wall Street, and created a perfect storm."

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2016 in an interview on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "Undocumented immigrants pay $12 billion of taxes every single year."

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2016 in an interview on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton has "taken hundreds of millions from those countries" where "women are stoned, where women are killed for adultery and women can't drive."

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2016 in a response at a legislative hearing on water quality and contamination:
quote_txt: "No fracking waste is being dumped in New York State"

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2016 in a political advertisement:
quote_txt: Says Proposition 205 "blocks market entry" for new marijuana dispensaries.

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2016 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Tom Nelson "backed higher taxes on Social Security, costing Wisconsin seniors $95 million."

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2016 in a CNN town hall:
quote_txt: "Since I came into office … we have increased the VA budget by 85 percent."

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2016 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "gave up 20 percent of America's uranium supply to Russia."

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2016 in a mailer:
quote_txt: "Amendment 2 will bring kid-friendly pot candy to Florida."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2016 in a White House press conference:
quote_txt: "If you look at any real analysis," the Trans-Pacific Partnership is "going to generate better-paying jobs that are more stable."

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2016 in an interview with Cosmo:
quote_txt: Says "Gary Johnson and the Libertarian Party want to get rid of the public school system."

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2016 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Miami Congressman Carlos "Curbelo supports drilling offshore" and "repeatedly voted against President Obama's ability to fight pollution and combat climate change."

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2016 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to bring in thousands of refugees to America from all around the world without any kind of security screening."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2016 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says Rob Portman "even voted to allow people on the terrorism watch list to buy guns."

description_txt: stated on September 26, 2016 in a presidential debate at Hofstra University:
quote_txt: "These people that we were going to deport for good reason ended up becoming citizens. Ended up becoming citizens. And it was 800. And now it turns out it might be 1,800, and they don't even know."

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2016 in a letter to state health officials:
quote_txt: "Not one illness has been reported from raw milk in" Texas "in more than four years. A total of six illnesses have occurred in the last 20 years."

description_txt: stated on September 1, 2016 in an interview on MSNBC:
quote_txt: Says most illegal immigrants draw "welfare benefits, they’re sending their kids to school, they’re using the public services."

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2016 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says "Catherine Cortez Masto failed Nevada rape victims. While attorney general, thousands of rape kits were never sent for DNA analysis."
